meanings.definition: To accustom or become accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the mountains, it took some time for the family to climatize to the colder weather.
meanings.sent2: The tropical plants needed to climatize to the dry desert conditions before they could thrive.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to climatize to the hot desert by wearing a tiny sunhat.
meanings.sent4: She had to climatize to the fast-paced city life after living in a quiet village for years.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to climatize to the zero-gravity environment of space before the mission.

meanings.definition: To make suitable for a particular climate.
meanings.sent1: The special coating on the house helped climatize it for the extreme cold of the Arctic.
meanings.sent2: The farmers used advanced techniques to climatize the soil for growing exotic fruits.
meanings.sent3: The scientist invented a machine to climatize any room to feel like a sunny beach.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative design aimed to climatize the car interior for both hot summers and cold winters.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to climatize the fabric to withstand the harsh weather conditions of the mountain region.
